title: Brave Web Search
description: Summarizes in few sentences the web search results with a default freshness of the past month.

params.title: Quick Preview Schema
params.description:
This field lets you format response data for easy reading. Define key-path pairs in JSON, where the key is the header and the value is the data path.
Example: `{ "Name": "result.user.name", "Email": "result.contact.email" }`

value.string:
Summarize the following web search results to be as concise as possible while retaining unique or important information. Avoid any introductory phrases.

{{12.concatenated}}
value.text:
Summarize the following web search results to be as concise as possible while retaining unique or important information. Avoid any introductory phrases.

{{12.concatenated}}

params.title: Model ID
params.description: When the "Model ID" field is filled in, the "Auto Router" toggle is ignored. Either the "Model ID" field must be filled in, or the "Auto Router" toggle must be enabled.

params.title: User Prompt
params.description: Your new question prompt: please note that at least one of the "User Prompt", "Dialogue History"

default.string: Hello! Let's talk about the following: {query}

params.title: Auto Router
params.description: Enables automatic selection of an alternative model from the "Models Rerouting" list. When disabled, the routing logic is skipped.

params.title: Models Rerouting
params.description: If the primary model's providers are down, rate-limited, or refuse to reply due to content moderation, then the chosen models will be used

options.value: 💸 Google: Gemini 2.0 Flash Experimental (free) - Gemini Flash 2.0 offers a significantly faster time to first token (TTFT) compared to [Gemini Flash 1.5](/google/gemini-flash-1.5), while maintaining quality on par with larger models like [Gemini Pro 1.5](/google/gemini-pro-1.5). It introduces notable enhancements in multimodal understanding, coding capabilities, complex instruction following, and function calling. These advancements come together to deliver more seamless and robust agentic experiences.

💸 Google: Gemma 3 12B (free) - Gemma 3 introduces multimodality, supporting vision-language input and text outputs. It handles context windows up to 128k tokens, understands over 140 languages, and offers improved math, reasoning, and chat capabilities, including structured outputs and function calling. Gemma 3 12B is the second largest in the family of Gemma 3 models after [Gemma 3 27B](google/gemma-3-27b-it)

💰 Google: Gemini 2.0 Flash Lite - Gemini 2.0 Flash Lite offers a significantly faster time to first token (TTFT) compared to [Gemini Flash 1.5](/google/gemini-flash-1.5), while maintaining quality on par with larger models like [Gemini Pro 1.5](/google/gemini-pro-1.5), all at extremely economical token prices. [0.075$/M input + 0.3$/M output]

params.title: File Content
params.description: Enter a URL (e.g., https://example.png) or select file content from the data pop-up window (e.g., 1.body.files.[0].content)

params.title: Dialog History JSON
Search Context Size
params.description: Amount of web content used to help the tool answer your question. Applies only to these [models](https://openrouter.ai/models?fmt=cards&supported_parameters=web_search_options).

params.title: Max Tokens
params.description: An upper bound for the number of tokens that can be generated for a completion, including visible output tokens and reasoning tokens.

params.title: Temperature
params.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. We generally recommend altering this or "Top P" but not both. [Read more](https://openrouter.ai/docs/api-reference/parameters#temperature).

params.title: Seed
params.description: Repeated requests with the same seed and parameters return the same result. Determinism is not guaranteed for some models. [Read more](https://openrouter.ai/docs/api-reference/parameters#seed).

params.title: Top P
params.description: Number between 0 and 1. An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with "Top P" probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. We generally recommend altering this or "Temperature" but not both. [Read mode](https://openrouter.ai/docs/api-reference/parameters#top-p).

params.title: Top K
params.description: Limits the model’s choice of tokens at each step, making it choose from a smaller set. [Read more](https://openrouter.ai/docs/api-reference/parameters#top-k).

params.title: Frequency Penalty
params.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Controlling the repetition of tokens based on how often they appear in the input. [Read more](https://openrouter.ai/docs/api-reference/parameters#frequency-penalty).

params.title: Presence Penalty
params.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Repeats specific tokens already used in the input. [Read more](https://openrouter.ai/docs/api-reference/parameters#presence-penalty).

params.title: Repetition Penalty
params.description: Number between 0.0 and 2.0. Reduces the likelihood of the model repeating words or phrases. A higher value makes the output more varied by discouraging repetition. [Read more](https://openrouter.ai/docs/api-reference/parameters#repetition-penalty).

params.title: Stop Sequences
params.description: Stop generation immediately if the model encounter any token specified in the stop array

params.title: Logit Bias
params.description: Adjusts the likelihood of specific tokens being selected by modifying their logits. Values range from -100 to 100. [Read more](https://openrouter.ai/docs/api-reference/parameters#logit-bias). For example: In the 'Key' field, enter "-80", in the 'Value' field, enter "10".

params.title: Logprobs
params.description: Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not. If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned.

params.title: Top Logprobs
params.description: Number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability

params.title: Min P
params.description: Minimum probability for a token to be considered, relative to the probability of the most likely token. [Read more](https://openrouter.ai/docs/api-reference/parameters#min-p).

params.title: Top A
params.description: Consider only the top tokens with "sufficiently high" probabilities based on the probability of the most likely token. [Read more](https://openrouter.ai/docs/api-reference/parameters#top-a).

params.title: Response Format JSON
params.description:
For example: { "type": "json_schema", "json_schema": { "name": "weather", "strict": true, "schema": { "type": "object", "properties": { "location": { "type": "string", "description": "City or location name" }, "temperature": { "type": "number", "description": "Temperature in Celsius" }, "conditions": { "type": "string", "description": "Weather conditions description" } }, "required": ["location", "temperature", "conditions"], "additionalProperties": false } } }  
    [Read more](https://openrouter.ai/docs/features/structured-outputs).

params.title: Tools JSON
params.description:
For example: [{"type":"function","function":{"name":"search_gutenberg_books","description":"Search for books in the Project Gutenberg library based on specified search terms","parameters":{"type":"object","properties":{"search_terms":{"type":"array","items":{"type":"string"},"description":"List of search terms to find books in the Gutenberg library (e.g. ['dickens', 'great'] to search for books by Dickens with 'great' in the title)"}},"required":["search_terms"]}}}]  
    [Read more](https://openrouter.ai/docs/features/tool-calling).

params.title: Reasoning Effort
params.description: OpenAI-style reasoning effort setting

params.title: Reasoning Max Tokens
params.description: Non-OpenAI-style reasoning effort setting. Cannot be used simultaneously with effort.

params.title: Reasoning Exclude
params.description: Whether to exclude reasoning from the response

params.title: Quick Preview Schema
params.description:
This field lets you format response data for easy reading. Define key-path pairs in JSON, where the key is the header and the value is the data path.
Example: `{ "Name": "result.user.name", "Email": "result.contact.email" }`

params.title: Brave API Access Token
params.description: Your Brave Search API subscription token (x-subscription-token header)

params.title: Query String
params.description: The search query you want to use

params.title: Freshness
params.description: Freshness filter (pd=past day, pw=past week, pm=past month, py=past year)

params.title: Quick Preview Schema
params.description:
This field lets you format response data for easy reading. Define key-path pairs in JSON, where the key is the header and the value is the data path.
Example: `{ "Name": "result.user.name", "Email": "result.contact.email" }`

value.string: {"summary": "There were no search results for that topic."}
value.text: {"summary": "There were no search results for that topic."}
